one.title: FIRST DAY: Read the notes and the references.

questions.questionText: 1. Use this space to record how you have seen God's activity during the week. (How has He provided, answered, comforted, reconciled, guided, etc.?)
2. What from the notes, lecture, group sharing or personal study impacted you most in the past week?

two.title:
SECOND DAY: Read Acts 12:1-5.
Herod persecuted the church in Jerusalem.

questions.questionText: 4. What do you learn about seeking worldly approval? How does this differ from what Christians value or seek? (See Galatians 1:6-10.)
5. How does the persecution of others impact you? What could you pray for believers who are suffering?

three.title:
THIRD DAY: Read Acts 12:6-11.
God miraculously delivered Peter.

questions.questionText: 6. Describe Peter's escape. What interests you most about the escape?
7. a. What does Peter's escape and James' death teach you about obedience?
7. b. Where do you have difficulty accepting God's ways? What have you learned about God that could help you?

four.title:
FOURTH DAY: Read Acts 12:12-17.
Peter gathered with his fellow believers.

questions.questionText: 8. What do you learn about prayer? (See 12:5) 9 a. How does this passage shape your beliefs about the power of prayer?
8. b. How does it impact the content of your prayers?

five.title:
FIFTH DAY: Read Acts 12:18-25.
Herod died, and the Church thrived.

questions.questionText: 10. Describe the end of Herod in your own words.
11. What do you learn about God? What do you learn about people?
12. Where is the Word of God flourishing in your church and community? What is God asking you to do to spread His Word?
13. What attribute of God resonated most from your study of this week's passage, and how do you see that attribute displayed in the world today?
14. Passage Discovery (homiletics, word study, etc.) for group and administrative leaders: Acts 12
